Package icyllis.arc3d.engine

Class TextureProxy

java.lang.Object
icyllis.arc3d.core.RefCnt
icyllis.arc3d.engine.SurfaceProxy
icyllis.arc3d.engine.TextureProxy
All Implemented Interfaces:
RefCounted, IScratchKey, ISurface
Direct Known Subclasses:
RenderTextureProxy
public class TextureProxy extends SurfaceProxy implements IScratchKey
The TextureProxy targets an actual GpuTexture with three instantiation methods: deferred, lazy-callback and wrapped. Multiple TextureProxy objects may target the same GpuTexture based on dependencies and actual usage. See SurfaceProxy for more info.

Use SurfaceProvider to obtain TextureProxy objects.

This class can only be used on the creating thread of/on a single RecordingContext, and later used by DirectContext (render thread).

Note: the object itself is also used as the scratch key, see hashCode() and equals(Object)

  • Constructor Details

    • TextureProxy

      public TextureProxy(BackendFormat format, int width, int height, int surfaceFlags)
      Deferred version - no data

    • TextureProxy

      public TextureProxy(BackendFormat format, int width, int height, int surfaceFlags, SurfaceProxy.LazyInstantiateCallback callback)
      Lazy-callback version - takes a new UniqueID from the shared resource/proxy pool.

    • TextureProxy

      public TextureProxy(@SharedPtr GpuTexture texture, int surfaceFlags)
      Wrapped version - shares the UniqueID of the passed texture.

      Takes UseAllocator because even though this is already instantiated it still can participate in allocation by having its backing resource recycled to other uninstantiated proxies or not depending on UseAllocator.

      Overrides:

    • isPromiseProxy

      public final boolean isPromiseProxy()

    • isMipmapped

      public boolean isMipmapped()
      If we are instantiated and have a target, return the mip state of that target. Otherwise, returns the proxy's mip state from creation time. This is useful for lazy proxies which may claim to not need mips at creation time, but the instantiation happens to give us a mipmapped target. In that case we should use that for our benefit to avoid possible copies/mip generation later.

    • isMipmapsDirty

      public final boolean isMipmapsDirty()

    • setMipmapsDirty

      public final void setMipmapsDirty(boolean dirty)

    • isUserMipmapped

      public final boolean isUserMipmapped()
      Returns the Mipmapped value of the proxy from creation time regardless of whether it has been instantiated or not.

    • hasRestrictedSampling

      public final boolean hasRestrictedSampling()
      If true then the texture does not support MIP maps and only supports clamp wrap mode.
